snippet.title: Gamedev Timelapse + Affectus OST by Kounine
snippet.description:
What does the level designing of an indie game look like?
When I started working on my new level, I thought about sharing my creative process. So here it is, almost 4 hours of uncut work capture while listening to the great OST made by Kevin "KOUNINE" Colombin.  I hope you enjoy it.

CHAPTERS:
Intro: (0:00)
Level design on paper: (0:03)
Fixing a small bug...: (0:07)
Start building level: (0:34)
Wall with UModeler: (1:31)
Add materials from Quixel: (1:46)
Looking for lamps: (2:35)
Adding lights: (3:01)
Let's make the hatch: (3:24)
Making the hiding closet: (4:36)
Setup the hiding script: (5:22)
Testing: (6:41)
Adding more props: (6:59)
Let's add the ladder: (7:58)
Adding more lights: (8:38)
Cutting the ladder: (9:47)
Let's add some plants: (10:30)
More props: (10:42)
Result: (13:33)

If you like what you see, please consider adding the game to your wishlist on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1478710/Affectus/

Affectus is a cyberpunk action-RPG set in a decadent and sick megalopolis, where the only way to feel good is a drug called Affectus. With no memory, you must unravel the mysteries of your past. Acquire implants, infiltrate, hack, or fight to uncover a vast conspiracy and find a cure to the virus.
